technology.title: Trump Stops Canada Trade Talks Over New Tech Tax, Raising Tensions for Businesses
technology.content: President Trump halts trade talks with Canada due to new tech tax targeting US tech firms. The tax, a 3% levy on digital services, mostly affects companies like Google, Amazon, and Meta. The dispute could lead to higher costs for businesses and consumers on both sides, and is a potential obstacle for the wider economy in both countries.

technology.title: Silicon Valley’s Nuclear Bet: Why Tech Titans Are Powering Up America’s Next Energy Race
technology.content: Tech titans Bill Gates, Sam Altman, and Peter Thiel are investing billions in nuclear energy to ensure stable electricity for AI and maintain U.S. competitiveness with China. The International Energy Agency projects a record high in nuclear electricity production by 2025, with China also ramping up nuclear capacity. This shift signals a new era in U.S. energy, driven by industry needs and national security, not just environmental goals.

technology.title: Google and Meta Warn of Free Speech Risks After Brazil’s Supreme Court Ruling on Tech Liability
technology.content: Google and Meta express concerns over freedom of speech and digital economy impact following Brazil's Supreme Court ruling that expands tech liability for user-posted content, requiring platforms to act on private notifications for unlawful material. The new rules could introduce legal uncertainty and operational challenges.

technology.title: Why Innovation Clusters Reject Populism in the U.S. While Surrounding Areas Embrace It
technology.content: A study by Cambridge University Press reveals technology hubs in the U.S. consistently reject populist candidates, while surrounding areas support them. This divide is due to the dependence of innovation clusters on global supply chains, immigration, and international cooperation, which are threatened by populist economic policies.

technology.title: Florianópolis and Recife: New Stars in Latin America’s Startup Scene
technology.content: Florianópolis and Recife, Brazil's 'Silicon Island' and emerging tech hub, are making waves in Latin America's startup scene, with Florianópolis leading in startup density, funding, and internet speed, while Recife benefits from lower operational costs and government support.

technology.title: Meta Invests $3.5 Billion to Bring More A.I. to Ray-Ban Smart Glasses
technology.content: Meta invests $3.5B in EssilorLuxottica to boost AI capabilities in Ray-Ban Smart Glasses, aiming to make AI-powered glasses as common as smartphones. The partnership will increase production capacity to 10 million units annually by 2026.

technology.title: A.I.’s Imperial Quest: Echoes of the East India Company’s Ruin
technology.content: Op-Ed analysis compares the ambitions and potential harm of modern AI giants to the East India Company, warning of erosion of democracy and equity. AI firms control global tech market, exploit resources, and threaten social cohesion, echoing the EIC's destructive legacy.

technology.title: Paraguay’s Startup Scene Climbs Global Ranks but Faces Tough Hurdles
technology.content: Paraguay's startup scene advances globally, ranking 97th worldwide and 8th in South America. The government supports growth through digital initiatives, but challenges persist, including limited funding, unclear regulations, and a shortage of skilled workers. Despite these hurdles, the sector shows promise with a focus on fintech, agritech, and e-commerce.

finance.title: Kenya’s Kirubi Group: A Business Engine Shaping the Nation’s Economy
finance.content: Kenya's Kirubi Group, founded by late business magnate Chris Kirubi, is a leading conglomerate shaping Kenya's economy through investments in manufacturing, real estate, media, and finance. Under new leadership, the group continues to innovate, investing in renewable energy and sustainable practices.

finance.title: Mexico’s Economy Grows Slightly in May Amid Trade and Debt Challenges
finance.content: Mexico's economy grew by 0.1% in May 2025 amid trade challenges, particularly from US tariffs on steel, aluminum, and automobiles. The auto industry and domestic consumption are struggling, leading to a projected growth of only 0.1% for the year. Inflation remains high and public debt is at a record high, limiting government spending.

finance.title: Paraguay’s Economy Grows Steadily as Services and Construction Lead Gains
finance.content: Paraguay's economy grew by 4.9% in Q1 2025, driven by services and construction. Services sector accounts for 40% of economic output, with strong performances in financial intermediation, household services, and transport. Construction activity increased, boosting demand for materials and equipment. Foreign trade balance showed a surplus, thanks to increased beef, offal, and manufactured agricultural goods exports. The economy remains stable with inflation at 4% and GDP growth projected at 3.8% for 2025.

finance.title: U.S. Tariffs Push Japan’s Economy Toward Recession as Exports Falter
finance.content: New U.S. tariffs on Japanese goods are causing a slump in Japan's exports, pushing the economy towards a potential recession. The trade deficit has widened, and negotiations to reduce or remove tariffs, especially on cars, are ongoing.

finance.title: Gaming, Gadgets, and Growth: Campus Party Brasil 17 Highlights Brazil’s Digital Economy
finance.content: Campus Party Brasil 17, held in Brasília, showcased Brazil's thriving digital economy with a focus on gaming, gadgets, and networking. The event attracted over 6000 participants, including software developers, entrepreneurs, and cosplayers. The gaming competition, Just Dance, and business exhibitions highlighted the event's significance for both entertainment and business growth.

finance.title: Comic Con Bogotá 2025: Pop Culture Event Boosts Business in Colombia
finance.content: Colombia's Comic Con Bogotá 2025 attracts over 40,000 attendees, showcasing comics, anime, games, and movies. Big names like Drake Bell and Mika Kobayashi attend, boosting local economy and highlighting the growth of Colombia's creative businesses.

finance.title: Brazilian Business Visas to U.S. Surge in 2025 as Entrepreneurs Seek Opportunity
finance.content: In 2025, a surge in Brazilian business visas to the U.S. indicates increasing entrepreneurial migration. The EB-1, EB-2, and EB-5 visas are popular choices for long-term business and professional migration. The U.S.'s stable business environment and clearer tax rules attract Brazilian entrepreneurs seeking growth and a better life.

finance.title: Paraguay’s June Inflation Hits 0% as Food Prices Drop, Economy Holds Steady
finance.content: Paraguay's June inflation holds steady at 0% due to falling food prices, with annual inflation rising slightly to 4.0%. Gasoline and diesel prices rose, but construction, services, and energy sectors saw growth. The economy expanded by 5.9% in Q1 2025, with construction and energy sectors leading.

travel.title: U.S. Tourism Drops as Brazil Becomes a Key Source of Visitors
travel.content: U.S. tourism is declining due to factors like trade tariffs and immigration rules, with fewer visitors from traditional countries such as Canada, Mexico, and Europe. However, Brazil is bucking this trend, with a 20% increase in visitors to the U.S. in 2024. Despite this, Brazilian visitor numbers dropped by 21% in early 2025. Meanwhile, Brazil's own tourism industry is booming, with a 51% increase in international tourists in the first four months of 2025.

travel.title: Argentina Faces Dollar Shortage as More Citizens Travel Abroad and Fewer Tourists Visit
travel.content: Argentina faces a growing dollar shortage due to increasing outbound travel and decreasing tourism. nearly 1.8 million Argentines traveled outside the country in Feb 2025, while only 494,000 foreign tourists visited, draining dollars from the economy. The government needs to strike a balance between allowing travel and keeping enough dollars to avoid a financial crisis.

travel.title: The Reality Behind Brazil’s Tourism Record: A Giant’s Struggle for Global Tourists
travel.content: Brazil's 'tourism record' of 8 million foreign visitors is dwarfed by other destinations, despite its size and natural wonders. Barriers such as distance, safety concerns, language, cost, and image hinder Brazil's tourism growth.

travel.title: SKY Airline Adds More Flights Between Chile and Brazil, Making Travel Easier and Cheaper
travel.content: SKY Airline increases flights between Chile and Brazil by 40%, offering 62 weekly flights for the winter season, aiming to make travel more affordable and accessible. The new routes include Santiago to Porto Alegre and Belo Horizonte.

travel.title: Trump Administration Considers Major Expansion of U.S. Travel Ban, Mostly to African Nations
travel.content: The Trump administration is planning to expand its travel ban, targeting up to 36 countries, mostly in Africa. This move, aimed at boosting national security, may affect key U.S. trade and security partners such as Egypt and Djibouti. The new ban, set to take effect after a 60-day compliance window, will impact many seeking business, education, or family opportunities in the U.S.

travel.title: Missed Flights and Long Waits: Madrid Airport Faces Summer Travel Crisis
travel.content: Madrid's main airport faced a travel crisis on July 2, 2025, with long lines and missed flights due to a lack of police officers and a surge in summer travelers. The airport served 5.74 million passengers in May, a 1% increase from the previous year, and the passport control areas struggled to handle the growth. Temporary border checks during a big international meeting in Seville further exacerbated the problem.

travel.title: Copa Airlines Grows Routes, Strengthens Panama’s Position as Key Connector in the Americas
travel.content: Copa Airlines expands its routes, connecting 91 cities in 32 countries, strengthening Panama's position as a key travel and business hub in the Americas. By adding flights to Los Cabos, Mexico, Santiago de los Caballeros in the Dominican Republic, and Salvador de Bahia in Brazil, Copa Airlines aims to carry over 18 million passengers this year, with growth anticipated.

travel.title: Air Europa Strengthens Panama-Europe Ties with New Daily Flight Schedule
travel.content: Air Europa increases daily flights between Panama City and Madrid, offering more travel options and better connectivity for passengers. The modern Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner planes, known for their fuel efficiency and comfort, will be used on this route.

world.title: Brazil’s Lula Vows an Eye for an Eye Against Trump’s 50% Tariff

Notable economist Paul Krugman has criticized Trump for the move, calling it 'evil and megalomaniacal'.

weather.title: EU Scales Back Green Rules to Help Businesses and Farmers
weather.content: The European Union is relaxing green regulations to aid businesses and farmers, aiming to balance climate action with economic growth. weather.title: The Importance and Current Reality of Peru’s Fishing Sector
weather.content: Peru's fishing sector experienced a significant 329% increase in production in 2024, mainly due to a record anchovy season. news.title: Air India plane crash: Ill-fated runway 23 of Ahmedabad airport back in news after 1988 accident
news.content: A second major plane crash at Ahmedabad airport's runway 23 since 1988 occurred on Thursday, killing 133 out of 139 passengers in 1988. The latest crash, involving an Air India flight to London, may be linked to pilot error and poor visibility. Both crashes resulted in high degrees of negligence, as confirmed by investigations.

news.title: Dubai Police step up traffic safety drive for ‘Summer Without Accidents’ campaign
news.content: Dubai Police launched a traffic safety drive for the 'Summer Without Accidents' campaign, aiming to reduce traffic accidents and fatalities. Major General Al Ghaithi highlighted distraction, particularly mobile phone use, as a leading cause of accidents. The UAE government, private sector, and Dubai Police are collaborating to ensure vehicle maintenance and offer free inspections during the summer.

news.title: US strikes Iran’s nuclear sites: What we know so far — and what could happen next
news.content: The US has bombed three of Iran's nuclear sites, escalating the Israel-Iran conflict. The US claims the facilities were 'completely and fully obliterated', and warns of further strikes if Iran retaliates. Iran maintains its nuclear program is peaceful, but Israel considers it an existential threat.

news.title: The Epstein files, the US government’s denial, and a MAGA meltdown
news.content: The US Justice Department denies the existence of Jeffrey Epstein's 'client list' and refuses to release additional files related to his sex trafficking investigation. The announcement contradicts months of claims made by Trump-era Attorney General Pam Bondi and has sparked outrage within the MAGA movement, with Elon Musk escalating his criticism of Trump's administration.

news.title: The UAE Growth and Investment Forum gets underway today at V Hotel Dubai
news.content: The UAE Growth and Investment Forum, sponsored by Ajman Free Zone, kicks off today at V Hotel Dubai, bringing together policymakers, business leaders, and investors for discussions on investment opportunities, regulatory compliance, and the evolving role of free zones in the UAE's growth strategy. Keynote speakers include Dr. Maria Hanif Al Qassim and Ismail Al Naqi, Director-General of the Free Zones Authority of Ajman.

news.title: UAE businesses get clarity on VAT invoices for imports
news.content: UAE businesses have received clarity on VAT invoicing for imports, as the Federal Tax Authority (FTA) has confirmed that businesses are not required to issue tax invoices to themselves for imported services. FTA also announced that businesses can recover input credit on VAT paid under the reverse charge mechanism on imported services, even without issuing tax invoices to themselves. The decision is expected to save costs for UAE businesses.

news.title: Content scraping, and the AI gold rush: Why Meta, Apple, and Samsung are chasing Perplexity — and stirring up a storm
news.content: Tech giants Meta, Apple, and Samsung are reportedly courting Perplexity AI, a company known for its 'answer engine' search engine that could rival Google. The platform, backed by investors like Jeff Bezos and Nvidia, offers AI-powered search, content scraping, and user-centric features. However, it's controversial for content scraping without permission, raising concerns of 'AI plagiarism'.

news.title: Trump says US and Iranian officials will talk next week as ceasefire holds
news.content: U.S. and Iranian officials are set to talk next week amid a ceasefire between Israel and Iran, raising hopes for a potential long-term peace. Trump claimed the U.S. strikes had destroyed Iran's nuclear program, but Iran insists it will not give it up.

finance.title: Etihad Airways deal on 25% airfare discount is ending soon

finance.title: Binance enters Islamic Finance with new Sharia-compliant crypto product

This move is seen as a potential benchmark for Sharia-compliant digital finance.

travel.content: A new report by Boston Consulting Group foresees the leisure travel market tripling from $5 trillion in 2024 to $15 trillion by 2040, with emerging economies like China, India, and Saudi Arabia driving significant growth. The travel industry is projected to surpass both pharmaceuticals and fashion in value.

travel.title: Smart travel: Here is how you can unlock more destinations with your UAE Schengen visa
travel.content: Discover more destinations with your UAE Schengen visa! Use it to enter non-Schengen countries like Cyprus, Albania, Bosnia, Montenegro, Serbia, North Macedonia, Kosovo, Andorra, Monaco, San Marino, Vatican City, Mexico, Colombia, Sao Tome and Principe, Turkey, Antigua and Barbuda, Dominican Republic. travel.title: UAE-US travel: Countries UAE travellers can visit with a valid B1/B2 American visa
travel.content: US B1/B2 visa enables visa-free or simplified entry to numerous countries, including Mexico, Canada, and several in Europe and Asia. Always verify the latest requirements and conditions.

travel.title: Iran-Israel conflict: Don’t cancel or change flights, travel agents urge travellers
travel.content: Travel agencies in UAE advise against cancelling or changing flights amid airspace closures in the region. Airlines are responsible for rescheduling and rebooking affected passengers without additional charges. Passengers are encouraged to wait and let airlines handle decisions regarding flight rescheduling.

travel.title: Saudi Arabia: 18.7% tourism surge in Medina in 2024
travel.content: Tourism in Saudi Arabia's holy city of Medina surged by 18.7% in 2024, reaching over 18 million visitors. This growth is attributed to expanded activity in accommodation, travel agencies, and tour operations, and is seen as a significant driver of economic growth. Notable attractions include the Prophet’s Mosque and over 400 religious, historical, and cultural landmarks.

travel.title: How to travel from Dubai to Salalah by bus this Khareef season
travel.content: During the Khareef season, traveling from Dubai to Salalah by bus is gaining popularity due to its affordability, with options like Beautiful Salalah Tours offering all-inclusive packages for an immersive experience. Prices start at Dh1400 and include round-trip bus travel, hotel stays, local transfers, and guided sightseeing.

travel.title: No travel ban on Indians: Saudi Arabia’s temporary visa restrictions linked to Hajj season
travel.content: Saudi Arabia lifts temporary travel restrictions on Indian nationals, following the end of visa regulations introduced for Hajj season management. The restriction was not a targeted travel ban and affects short-term visa categories only. The Kingdom remains a popular destination for Indian expats and pilgrims.

travel.title: Dubai College of Tourism opens global pathways in UK for its students
travel.content: Dubai College of Tourism partners with Edinburgh Napier University to offer Dubai students direct entry into select UK bachelor's degree programs in hospitality, tourism, events, and business management. The collaboration includes a 10% tuition discount for DCT graduates.

world.title: Al Ain FC FIFA Club World Cup 2025 Guide: Signings, fixtures and battle against European giants
world.content: Al Ain FC, a UAE powerhouse with 14 league titles and 2 Asian Champions League victories, have qualified for the expanded FIFA Club World Cup 2025. Key players like Soufiane Rahimi, Kodjo Fo-Doh Laba, and Kaku aim to make a difference.

world.title: Top 10 happiest cities in the world in 2025
world.content: The Institute for Quality of Life has released its annual report on the happiest cities in the world in 2025. Topping the list is Copenhagen, Denmark, followed by Zurich, Switzerland, and Singapore. Other notable cities include Aarhus, Denmark; Antwerp, Belgium; Seoul, South Korea; Stockholm, Sweden; Taipei, Taiwan; Munich, Germany; and Rotterdam, Netherlands. Factors contributing to happiness include sustainability, economic success, education, and access to healthcare and digital proficiency.

world.title: World’s most peaceful countries of 2025 revealed
world.content: Iceland tops the 2025 Global Peace Index as the world's most peaceful country, with Ireland and New Zealand following closely. The rankings are based on societal safety, conflict levels, and militarization.

world.title: Good news: Bangladeshis can now apply for UAE Golden Visa remotely
world.content: Bangladeshi citizens can now apply for the UAE's Golden Visa remotely, with the aid of VFS Global and Rayad Group's new immigration advisory services in Dhaka. The services offer personalized guidance to eligible applicants, including entrepreneurs, professionals, and creatives, without the need for real estate investment or business setup.

world.title: Iran launches new wave of missile attacks on Israel as conflict enters Day 5
world.content: Iran has launched a new wave of missile attacks on Israel, marking the fifth day of conflict between the two nations. At least 224 people have been killed in Iran and 10 in Israel, with over 1,200 hospitalized in Iran. The US President has urged talks, but Iran refuses a ceasefire. Israel has reportedly proposed targeting Iran's Supreme Leader, a plan allegedly rejected by Trump.

weather.content: Heavy monsoon rains in Pakistan are causing flash floods, resulting in over 72 deaths and injury of more than 130 people. With escalating damage to homes and livestock, the worst may not be over as warnings for continued rain and flooding persist. Experts attribute this disaster to the intensifying effects of climate change, which has made Pakistan one of the most climate-vulnerable countries globally.

weather.content: UAE's Al Dahra achieves first carbon credits from Romania operations and expands regenerative farming practices, aiming to meet 2030 sustainability targets. weather.content: Abu Dhabi's Environment Agency – Abu Dhabi (EAD) achieves carbon neutrality certification twice, leading UAE's climate efforts. The program is designed for all vehicle types and is initially available to students enrolled in EDC's VIP car driving licence packages.

news.title: GE Vernova explores sale of Proficy software unit, Bloomberg News reports
news.content: GE Vernova considers selling its industrial software unit, Proficy, for up to $1 billion, boosted by surging domestic power demand, especially from AI, cryptocurrency data centers, and increased consumption. The deal could be valued between $900 million and $1 billion.

news.content: Tesla hires Henry Kuang, former Cruise executive, as AI director, aiming to expand robotaxi operations in the U.S. amid company-wide restructuring.

news.title: EU's top court adviser sides with Italy in Meta Platforms dispute
news.content: The EU's top court adviser has sided with Italy in a dispute with Meta Platforms (Facebook owner) over a fee the tech giant has to pay publishers for using news snippets. The EU court is considering whether national measures to strengthen publishers' positions are compatible with EU copyright legislation.

news.title: Shipping needs its own whistleblowing system
news.content: Captain Kuba Szymanski calls for a whistleblowing system in the maritime industry to combat inaccurate reports and improve its image. He highlights the industry's achievements, such as equal pay for seafarers and diversity, and its significant employment in Southeast Asian countries.

news.title: Japan Reveals New Guidelines for Incorporating AI into Defense Equipment
news.content: Japan unveils new guidelines for integrating AI into defense equipment, aiming to address legal, ethical, and operational risks. The guidelines aim to promote transparency for businesses while ensuring compliance with international law and regulations.

news.title: 2 Singaporeans among 3 arrested in Thailand in joint anti-vice sweep
news.content: Singaporean men among 3 arrested in Thailand for running a transnational vice syndicate. Assets worth millions were seized, and investigations are ongoing.

technology.title: Where maritime tech consolidation is today
technology.content: Two new maritime technology landscape maps reveal a fragmented market despite consolidation, with AI playing a significant role in several sectors. Europe is the dominant hub, but Asia and the Middle East show promising developments. Expert opinions suggest that integration and standardization are the main challenges.

technology.title: The convoluted maritime tech scene
technology.content: The maritime industry is rapidly adopting AI, with 72% of maritime tech startups in the condition and maintenance category integrating AI. Europe is a dominant hub, but Asia and the Middle East also have exciting developments. However, the fragmented market lacks standardisation and faces integration issues, with congestion over clarity being a growing vulnerability.

technology.title: JPMorgan expands tech team with Guggenheim veteran, memo says
technology.content: JPMorgan Chase hires Guggenheim Securities executive Mike Amez to expand tech team, focusing on mid-sized companies. Amez brings expertise in IT services, cybersecurity, and cloud infrastructure. The move comes as JPMorgan continues to solidify its position in tech banking.

technology.title: Chicago PE firm teams with Manish Singh to set up shipping tech acquisition fund
technology.content: Chicago PE firm GTCR partners with Manish Singh to form Maris Investments, a shipping tech acquisition fund worth hundreds of millions. The goal is to digitally transform the maritime industry by acquiring tech companies and building a market-leading platform. GTCR has invested over $30bn since 1980 and currently manages $50bn.

technology.title: Europeans seek 'digital sovereignty' as US tech firms embrace Trump
technology.content: Following Trump's re-election, Europeans are increasingly seeking digital sovereignty by switching to European-based tech services due to concerns about US tech firms' influence and data privacy. Companies like Ecosia and ProtonMail are benefiting from this shift.

technology.title: Modi government to establish ₹10,000cr fund for deep tech innovation
technology.content: Indian government unveils a ₹10,000 crore fund to bolster deep tech innovation, aiming to make India a global tech powerhouse. The move includes a $12 billion loan to the Department of Science and Technology for flexible capital deployment.

technology.content: In a slowing M&A market, deals in data infrastructure for AI are booming. technology.title: Unglamorous world of 'data infrastructure' driving hot tech M&A market in AI race

The manufacturing sector expects profit declines, particularly in automakers and auto parts makers due to anticipated US tariffs.

finance.title: Australia launches world’s first sustainable finance rulebook that includes mining
finance.content: Australia unveils the world's first sustainable finance rulebook for mining, focusing on copper, lithium, nickel, and iron ore. The framework aims to unlock global financing for green and transition sectors, such as agriculture and manufacturing.

finance.title: Pakistan's economy to grow 2.7% in fiscal 2025, survey shows
finance.content: Pakistan's economy is projected to grow by 2.7% in fiscal 2025, according to a government report, down from the initial target of 3.6%. The growth is attributed to a reduction in manufacturing output and a decline in major crops, with agricultural sector growth at a nine-year low. Despite this, the government aims for 4.2% growth next fiscal year.

finance.title: Malaysia’s Second Finance Minister Amir Hamzah to take over Economy Minister’s duties after Rafizi resignation
finance.content: Malaysia's Second Finance Minister Amir Hamzah takes over Economy Minister's duties following Rafizi's resignation. Amir Hamzah to revise the 13th Malaysia Plan to better reflect government aims and sustain economic reforms, as Rafizi had emphasized comprehensive educational reforms. Amir Hamzah was previously the chief executive of Malaysia's Employees Provident Fund.

finance.title: Stocks gain after weak ADP, gilt yields surge on finance minister worries
finance.content: Stocks remain steady despite weak jobs report, while UK gilt yields surge due to finance minister concerns. ADP data shows US private payrolls dropped by 33,000 jobs, sparking expectations for a July rate cut by the Fed. British government bond yields jumped after finance minister Rachel Reeves appeared distressed in parliament.

finance.title: Thai economy to slow in second half of 2025, central bank says
finance.content: Thailand's economy is projected to slow in the second half of 2025 due to US tariffs, according to the central bank. The economy was forecast to expand 2.3% this year and 1.7% in 2026. Exports, a key driver, are expected to contract 4% in the second half of the year.

finance.title: US$1 million needed to sustain blue carbon economy initiatives in the Philippines: UK conservation charity
finance.content: The UK's Blue Planet Fund has granted over $450,000 to the Philippines for blue carbon economy initiatives, but more funding is needed to sustain the program. The government plans to integrate blue carbon ecosystems into its updated NDCs, leveraging them for nature-based solutions and farming projects to address climate and biodiversity challenges.

travel.title: As Europe’s summer travel season heats up, transatlantic travel to the US declines
travel.content: Europe's summer tourism is buoyed by Asian tourists, particularly Chinese, despite a decline in transatlantic travel to the US. India, Indonesia, and Vietnam are emerging as key origin markets, but demand from traditional powerhouses like Japan and China is waning.

travel.title: Chan Brothers Travel to offer more tours, flights to Bhutan following partnership with Department of Tourism, Drukair
travel.content: Chan Brothers Travel partners with Bhutan's Department of Tourism and Drukair to offer more tours and direct flights, providing Singaporeans with exclusive opportunities to explore Bhutan's rich culture and natural beauty.

travel.title: Kerala government sponsored Pakistan 'spy' Jyoti Malhotra to promote tourism: RTI
travel.content: Kerala government sponsored a Pakistani 'spy' vlogger Jyoti Malhotra's tour to promote Kerala tourism, RTI reveals. Malhotra was part of a state-run influencer collaboration program, her visit included Kannur, Kozhikode, Kochi, Alappuzha, and Munnar.

travel.title: Why is Thai tourism stuttering and will its renewed focus on ‘quality over quantity’ work?
travel.content: Thailand faces a challenging rebranding in a competitive global tourism market, with countries like Malaysia and Vietnam courting the same travellers. The country is missing out on fierce competition for Chinese tourists' spending power, and needs to focus on both acquiring new visitors and retaining existing ones to recover its tourism-dependent economy.

travel.title: Fears over how Americans are perceived abroad dampen US travel enthusiasm
travel.content: International travel to the US is on a downturn due to rising costs and negative sentiments about the country, affecting jobs in the tourism sector. A tour guide in Washington DC reports a 85% drop in business since Trump resumed office, with inquiries from Canadians drying up after Trump's suggestion of Canada becoming the 51st US state.

travel.title: Goa to promote 'Ekadasha Teertha Yatra' for spiritual tourism
travel.content: Goa to launch 'Ekadasha Teertha Yatra' promoting spiritual tourism, featuring 11 iconic temples. Visitors will explore temples like Sri Manguesh and Sri Mahalasa Narayani over two to three days, with an aim for cultural preservation and holistic travel experience.

travel.title: STB revokes licences of 5 travel agents
travel.content: Singapore Tourism Board revokes licenses of 5 travel agents due to non-submission of audited statements and annual business profile returns. Agencies include Gemini Travel n Tours, Intersys, SGWanka, VS Travel, and Wizfair Travel. VS Travel was also revoked for failing to maintain minimum financial requirements.

travel.title: Thai economy slows in May on weaker tourism, production, central bank says
travel.content: Thai economy slows in May due to weaker tourism and production, according to the central bank.
